page.title: 07Wilmington Church
page.content:
The church of St.Mary and St.Peter, Wilmington is a typical downland church. It has been standing since the 12th Century. Originally it was made of wood but today it is made of stone.The churchyard has certainly been in use since Norman times and the oldest grave dates from 1707.
You enter the church through a 14th Century door and on your right is a 14th Century font. The Nave was rebuilt in the 14th Century and the Gothic Chancel Arch was erected in the 19th Century.
In the North Chapel is the Bee and Butterfly Window,a fine piece of stained glass probably of 15th Century Flemish origin. In the centre is St. Peter and around him are 8 butterflies,one moth and a bee.
